properties.areaDesc: Coastal Broward County; Inland Miami-Dade County; Metropolitan Miami Dade; Far South Miami-Dade County; Coastal Miami Dade County; Metro Broward County
properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 31 at 10:46PM EST by NWS Miami FL
properties.description:
* At 1044 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms
along a line extending from 6 miles northwest of Wilderness
Waterway to 7 miles northwest of Pa-Hay-Okee Overlook to 6 miles
northwest of Conch Key. Movement was east at 45 mph.

* Nickel size hail and wind gusts of 50 to 70 mph possible with
these storms. Present indications are that warnings may become
needed within the next hour.

* Locations impacted include...
Miami, Hialeah, Miramar, Miami Beach, Homestead, Coral Gables, Key
Biscayne, South Miami, Surfside, Miami Gardens, Turkey Point,
Virginia Key, Homestead Miami Speedway, Black Point, The Redland,
Kendall, Hallandale, North Miami, Doral and North Miami Beach.
properties.instruction:
These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio
stations and available television stations for additional
information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms, and may lead
to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded
roadways.

Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. If
you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck! Seek a safe
shelter inside a building or vehicle.

This activity was also developing in an environment favorable for the
formation of funnel clouds. Stay tuned to NOAA weather radio and
local media for additional updates and possible warnings.

To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement
agency. You can also share your report with NWS Miami on Facebook and
Twitter.

NWSheadline: SIGNIFICANT WEATHER ADVISORY FOR MIAMI-DADE COUNTY UNTIL 1115 PM EST
